intro: Bourreria guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan burr plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny capsules. Bourreria guatemalensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates.
